title: Rust CLI & Optimization Loop
description: CLI tool for batch processing, algorithm comparison, and optimization loops.

title: Scaffold CLI Tool
description: Extract core logic to shared module and implement basic clap-based CLI.

title: Implement Tracing Comparison Tool
description: Add capability to compare different vtracer settings and output stats (vertex count, file size).

title: Optimization Feedback Loop
description: Create a script to iterate over parameter ranges and find optimal settings for F-6100 constraints.

title: AI Input & Prompt Engineering
description: Integration with Gemini Nano Banana Pro and building the prompt assistant UI.

title: Gemini Nano Banana Pro Integration
description: Set up API client for image generation using Gemini 3 Pro Image.

title: Prompt Assistant Lit Component
description: Build Lit components for the 'Vector-Ready' prompt builder using M3 components.

title: Image Management Store
description: Use Signals to manage image lifecycle (loading, preview URLs).

title: Real Gemini API Integration
description: Connect the frontend to the actual image generation service.

title: [task] matteybanana-bez: Support Bézier curves in DXF Export
description: Currently DXF export flattens all curves to polylines. Implement proper SPLINE or high-order LWPOLYLINE support for smooth CNC paths.

title: Foundation & Scaffolding
description: Project initialization with Lit, Material 3, Signals, and Rust WASM environment.

title: Web App Initialization
description: Scaffold a Vite-based project using Lit and TypeScript.

title: Material 3 & State Setup
description: Integrate @material/web components and initialize Signal-based state store.

title: Rust WASM Workspace Initialization
description: Initialize wasm directory and Cargo.toml with image, dxf, vsvg, and wasm-bindgen.

title: WASM Bridge Verification
description: Create a basic 'Hello WASM' Lit component to verify TS-to-Rust communication.

title: Research & Implement Contour Hierarchy for Fills
description: Research algorithm to distinguish outer vs inner paths (holes). Update WASM to output SVG <path> with evenodd fill-rules. Evaluate DXF 'HATCH' support for legacy machines.

title: Interactive Preview & Export
description: Real-time vector preview, simplification controls, and final DXF export.

title: Vector Preview Lit Component
description: Lit component that renders simplified paths as SVG in real-time.

title: Simplification Controller
description: Bind M3 Slider to Signal triggering WASM simplification logic.

title: Export & Download Utility
description: Implement file blob handler to deliver .dxf or .MAT file.

title: Selection Border in Gallery
description: Add a clear visual border and shadow to the selected image in the gallery.

title: Export Format Selector UI
description: Add buttons or tabs to select between DXF and SVG output.

title: [task] matteybanana-api: Implement retry logic for Gemini API
description: Add exponential backoff and retry logic for the Gemini API call to handle transient network errors or rate limiting.

title: Implement Real Potrace Algorithm
description: Replace the dummy diamond shape with actual Moore-Neighbor or Potrace tracing in Rust.

title: UX Enhancements & Documentation
description: Improve the web app UX with an app bar, navigation, and educational resources.

title: Implement Top App Bar
description: Add a Material 3 top app bar with the Mattey Banana branding and actions.

title: Add GitHub Source Link
description: Include a GitHub icon/badge in the app bar pointing to the source repository.

title: Implement About & Glossary Modal
description: Add an 'About' button that opens a dialog explaining the app purpose and providing a glossary of CNC/Vector terms.

title: Rust-Powered Image Processing (WASM)
description: Core Rust logic for image decoding, tracing, simplification, and DXF generation.

title: Image Decoding & Grayscale (WASM)
description: Implement image crate logic to convert PNG/JPG inputs to B&W buffer.

title: Path Tracing & RDP Simplification (WASM)
description: Implement tracing algorithm and integrate vsvg for vertex reduction (<500 nodes).

title: DXF Generation Logic (WASM)
description: Implement the LWPolyline export logic into the WASM entry point.

title: Implement Real Tracing in WASM
description: Replace diamond placeholder with actual image-data-driven tracing (threshold + edge follow).

title: SVG Export in WASM
description: Add SVG string export capability to the Rust module.

title: Optimize SVG Export for Generative AI Animation (MorphLab Compat)
author: ghchinoy
body:
Mattey Banana is currently the perfect tool for converting PNG/JPEG silhouettes into highly precise linear coordinates (`L` commands) for physical plotters and CNC machines like the Fletcher-Terry F-6100.

However, we are now utilizing Mattey Banana outputs as the source SVGs for an AI animation tool called **MorphLab**.

MorphLab uses Gemini to intelligently animate standard SVGs. When we feed it Mattey Banana current linear SVG outputs, the AI times out or hits its output token limit because the `L` coordinate data creates files that are massive (60KB - 100KB) and incredibly dense.

### Requirements for Web/AI-Friendly SVGs
We need to build a distinct output mode specifically designed for web and AI consumption.

1. **Bézier Spline Curve Fitting**: Instead of relying solely on `path[i].0, path[i].1` straight lines in the `export_to_svg` Rust function, we need to utilize `visioncortex` capability to generate smooth Cubic Bézier Curves (`C` commands). This will drastically reduce vertex counts, dropping file sizes from 90KB down to ~5KB without losing visual fidelity.
2. **Semantic Path Islands**: Currently, `export_to_svg` loops through all discovered paths and concatenates them into a *single* `<path>` element with `fill-rule="evenodd"`. We need the option to emit distinct `<path>` elements for distinct, non-overlapping geometric islands. (This allows the AI to target specific parts of the drawing, like animating an arm independently of a head).
3. **Opt-in Only**: The core goal of Mattey Banana is still to drive physical hardware with raw polylines. This new AI-friendly Bézier/Semantic SVG export should be triggered via a distinct flag or UI toggle (e.g. "Web/Animation Optimized (Splines)" vs "CNC Optimized (Polylines)").

### Technical Starting Point
Look at `wasm/src/lib.rs`. 
- Focus on `trace_to_json()` and `export_to_svg()`.
- You may need to change what `trace_to_json` serializes (currently just vectors of points) to include spline control points if `is_spline` is set to true.

Update the Lit frontend (`frontend/src/`) to expose a setting to let the user choose which SVG variant they want downloaded.
